summary: The Stop Illegal Entry Act amends the Immigration and Nationality Act to increase penalties for individuals who illegally enter or reenter the United States. It increases penalties for those who illegally enter, attempts to enter or obtain entry through false representation and are then convicted of any crime punishable by more than one year imprisonment. The bill also expands penalties for previously removed aliens who reenter the US, with varying levels of punishment based on prior convictions, criminal history, and reason for removal.
